reviews.text: Parece que cuidan y respetan a los animales. Actividades: darles de comer, bañarlo, opcionalmente montar en ellos sin silla.

reviews.author_name: นพวิทย์ อูปเงิน

reviews.text: I am embarrassed to say that I went here. The elephants are not treated well at all!! Yes, you aren’t riding them, but that’s about the only work you are saving them from doing. The whole day, each group is getting shuffled from spot to spot. Each mahout has a bag and some sort of gun strapped to their hip, and they constantly prod the elephants and never leave them alone. It’s terrible to think this place is open every day of the year, so these animals don’t get any rest whatsoever. The mahouts only care about getting money. If you truly love elephants, do not support this place!

Such an amazing experience! This was our second time visiting Chiang Mai and we HAD to come back to this elephant sanctuary. The hosts were great and seemed to really care about the elephants. One of them said he caught the baby when it was born. It seemed to have a real connection with him. 

The baby was so playful. It galloped around and would initiate play with people. It loved doing a little push push game. If he pushed you, you pushed back you would start a little wrestle push war. So fun!! 

We were all able to feed the elephants, do a mud bath, and then clean up in the river. 

I highly recommend this. One of the best experiences of my life!

We have been to two of the Elephant Jungle Sanctuary camps near Chiang Mai, once for a half day, and once for a full day. Both trips were amazing. These are TRUE sanctuaries for the elephants where they are treated gently and with a great deal of respect. Their handlers give them lots of love and are never cruel or angry. Their only real concern is the safety of the elephants. The elephants are free to wander about as they like and enjoy the water and the jungle. The handlers are also sure that the tourists treat the animals with the utmost respect. The elephants are amazing beings that take in your love and attention (and any treats you may offer like bananas!). They love the attention when you rub mud on their bodies and then roll around in the river with them scrubbing them with brushes. We even got to play with a baby elephant on our last visit! 400 pounds of playful energy! Also, we did a jungle hike with 4 elephants. I have hiked all over the world, but never with an elephant as a companion! It is an experience that can't be missed when you are visiting Chiang Mai! Also, these camps not only give these animals a safe and loving environment to live in, but also raise awareness regarding animal abuse (especially the abuse of elephants- there is NO riding of elephants at these camps because riding causes them great pain and significantly shortens their life spans- plus an elephant has to be taken from its mother while very young and "broken" in a small cage to be a riding or work elephant- so cruel!) ) and help us lowly humans to make connections with these fantastic gentle animals so that we all try to help preserve them in the wild.

We chose this trip because they do not allow riding, which was really important to us. Our hotel tried to book us on another trip and said you don't have to ride, she missed the point - we didn't want to ride or be on a trip where our group had the opportunity to ride.

After a little research I found the Elephant Nature Park, however it was fully booked, with further research I found this one, which seemed very similar. If I had the choice I would have booked Elephant Nature Park and would like to return to visit Chiang Mai so that I can.

However, we did have a fabulous day at this Sanctuary! We visited Camp 4, I believe there are 9 camps altogether, each offering similar itineraries.

After a 2 hour transfer up into the jungle, we arrived at the camp and were instantly greeted by these beautiful animals! 

When we arrived we were briefly briefed on the background of the sanctuary in broken English. They two main hosts were lovely guys and did their best to answer any questions we had throughout the day.

The elephants were all very well treated during our visit, and were pretty much free to roam around but also guided round our itinerary of the day. When you think where these animals came from, their life is far better now.

Our favourite part was walking through the jungle with them as they just wondered off on their own, up the hill!

It did feel like they were forced down into the mud bath, some of them were not too fussed - they weren't in there for long before they up and headed straight to the river to rinse off all the mud - they certainly enjoyed that!!

It was an incredible experience to get up and close with these amazing animals.

Our group wasn't too big and we each had a turn feeding them and having our pictures taken with them.

Their keepers all seemed lovely, although one of the really young boys (he was only 12) I feel needs to have more respect for these animals - it felt like he was showing off quite a bit.

An absolute incredible experience, it has left me thinking how well are these animals treated when visitors leave - I like to think in the same way as when we were there, but I'm not 100% convinced.

I would say, if you really want to see elephants, this is one of the better places to visit and make your mind up yourself.

What a nice place to interact with elephants! The village I went to had 5 elephants. They were so playful and seemed happy. They are free to do whatever they want so it's not a place for you if you expect a show. The staff is really friendly and you can tell they have a very nice relationship with the animals. We fed the elephants, played in mud with them,  bathed them in the river and finally went for a walk in the forest with them. It was a great and relaxing day. It's important to support such ethical companies as they rely on visitors' fees to manage the village, rescue more elephants and take care of them.

We enjoyed everything here. It's a very simple place, not a fancy touristic hole. The guys are genuine and I like that nobody was forcing the elephants in doing stuff: we took a walk, they are some food and then they bathed. There wasn't a real guide, so don't expect many information. The only thing it was missing was some bottles of water for us - maybe better ask before starting the walk.

Not quite what I was hoping for. We booked the full day tour and only spent about two hours with the elephants. We arrived around 10, waited a while, fed the elephants from 11-12, ate lunch, took a half hour "rest", then gave them mud scrubs and baths in a man-made mud pit and a pretty small pond from about 2-3. There were 5 elephants and at least 30 people. I enjoyed feeding the baby elephants and splashing in the mud and water, it just wasn't the experience I was wanting. The half day tour might be a better idea. I will say, the mahouts seem to really care about the elephants and these are rescued elephants, which was important to me in trying to pick an elephant experience

Seemed to have ethical practices overall, but the tour left a lot to be desired. A "full day" tour gave us about 2 hours with the elephants. Lots of sitting around and doing nothing. People even took naps after lunch. We paid to see elephants -- not nap!
Nice little hostel and really lovely staff. Just the single bathroom becomes a problem if it's fully booked. Was staying there 6 days.

Did the half-day tour for 1700baht and it was the best $50-60 I've ever spent. Feeding the elephants including two baby ones, sloshing around a knee-deep mud bath and lathering their bodies with mud, and jumping into a pool and swimming with them was one of the most spectacular experiences of my life. The staff were also super friendly and accommodating. I have nothing but positive things to say about the experience, and the elephants looked happy and well taken care of.

Tip: Pay for the little bottles of milk to feed the baby elephants; it was too cute.

Wonderful place in nature of ChaingMai, Thailand. Huge and specious area where you will find lots of elephants who are well trained by their guides. You can ride on elephant using money. The elephants will play games- like football, they will also show hundreds of caricature for your enjoyment. The elephants can  drawing and painting; all are excellent. You will find lots of souvenirs here on elephants. You also can buy paintings by elephants. There are also postcards by elephant's design.

They where very friendly with us but I don't like when the animals are with chains or in cages. So I don't really recommend to support this tourism, i think is better when animals are free and happy. We have to be creative for human entertainment without affecting the animals or nature in general.

I love the elephants here. They are so adorable. I wouldn’t mind pay for the entrance fee at all because I feel like it’s a contribution for all these elephant. Every time I go to Chiangmai. I will definitely visit this place again and again and again.

It is never ok to ride elephants. Be a compassionate human. Elephants and all wild animals are NOT here for your entertainment or selfies. Watch them from a safe distance being happy and wild. Not in ropes and chains and cages. Do not support places like this.

I've been visiting here with visiting friends and family for 20 years. This visit was the best. We did the 1/2 day Mahout option. It includes a costume change and a hands on guide the entire time. There were 3 babies. Exciting to touch and feed these amazing animals. Ploy, our designated elephant is the quintessential gentle giant. We bathed and brushed her in the stream. Really wonderful.
My mother is laid to rest here years ago and I plan to visit again soon.

Small, well-kept cemetery with a fascinating array of graves of foreign residents of Chiang Mai from the distant past and present, including missionaries, veterans, and other former residents.  Some graves have very informative ephitaphs.  I had trouble finding it however, as the Google map location pointer is incorrect.  The actual cemetery is located just north (300 meters) of the Google marker, along the same road, on the east side of the road, across the street from the Electricity Office (purple and white building).
Peaceful place
헌신과 경건을 묵상할 수 있어서 좋다.

Nice place to hike and swim. If you want to go to swim, go to Number 6 station and relax. Entrance is 100 baht plus 20 baht if you came here with your scooter. It was tough hiking but very nice experience here! If you are nature lover, then this place is for you! 

When you climb, bring a lot of water because you will get dehydrated. Recommended to all!
Great views one hour hiking trail. Make sure you bring swimming cloths if you want to take a dip. Trust me too much walking and also 100 THB ticket to enter.

Mae Sa Waterfalls is a relatively large park with 10 medium-sized waterfalls, a few kilometres west of Mae Rim and about a half hours drive north of Chiang Mai.

There is an entrance fee paid just like a national park in the U.S., to a guy standing in a little wooden house wearing a park uniform. But the 200 Baht fee per person is worth it, plus an extra 30 for parking, even if you've arrived in a tuk tuk. 

After leaving the parking lot, you'll follow a cement walkway uphill along the side of each waterfall for the next 1.5 kilometres until the path comes to an abrupt end at the last fall. The vertical rise is 430 feet or about 43 floors; so climbing the trail involves a little bit of effort. 

The falls are between 4 and 10 metres high, but are really more cascades than vertical falls; lending a more gentle and mellow feel to the trip than you might otherwise expect.

A very calm place, plus the waterfall comes in 10 point, you could hike at your preference with your energy level. Very photogenic location too! If you love nature, this is a highly recommend location.

Nice place to visit if doing the Samoeng loop on scooter. 

With 100baht entrance fee (+20 for a motorbike) it's very popular place amongst locals to grab a lunch over weekend. 
I would recommend to visit early to avoid crowds and head to higher levels (6-10) to have a chance for a swim without screaming kids around

Highly recommended! This place is good for 2-3 hours visit. Please avoid going there on the weekend. Too crowded! If you have a chance to visit during the weekdays it will bring you joys and calms. Enjoy the nature. I love the cactus so much.

The area is just exceptional with a lot of nature activities. On the way, just after the entrance, there is a banana plantation. It's nice to discover so many varieties of banana trees. There is also a canopy from where you can walk up to the jungle and have a sight on a valley of high and old trees. You can find also an arboretum and small waterfalls. But the main point, is the wonderful botanical garden. You can see a lot of flowers in the best conditions and the place is so wonderful to take nice pictures of flowers, nature and your family or friends. The best way to visit is with a motorcycle or by foot.

If you enjoy the beauty of nature, this is an absolute must. This is probably my favorite day trip from Chiang Mai. 100 baht/adult to get in. I think 50 for kids. We arrived right as they opened at 8 on a holiday Monday. Pretty much all of the first groups of tourists went straight for the canopy walk area. If you're there first thing, go straight to the glass houses and you'll have them all to yourself. Amazingly beautiful gardens! We spent about 2.5 hours there and could easily have spent double that. It does get very busy though.

I visited this botanical garden during the winter, spectacular sight. The garden is open at 830am, visit first thing in the morning before the crowd come in. I can't rave enough about this beautiful place. You can see the famous coffin mountain during the trail walk, stunning roses and lovely plants, vegtations and lots n lots of butterflies. The gardeners and management did a great job maintaining this place. This is a must see. Don't miss it

Nice surprise. Reasonable entry fee and very nice plants and flowers. Only drawback is cost of transportation there (we paid 1300 THB for red taxi hired for 7 hours) and a bit misleading map of the whole botanical garden (it is quite a large) you get at the entrance.

Highly recommended, both adults and kids enjoyed it.

Good environment and all the seats are great, but the fights seem very staged. Of the 6 fights we watched three were round 1 knockouts, and the headliner lasted until the middle of the second. It did not feel very authentic and at best they were mismatches. The female fighters put in a great effort and gave great performance though!

reviews.author_name: พลพัตร ไฝเครือ
reviews.text: I am sorry for many people who went back first. The main pair will be in the back. Which is different from the first 2 to 3 pairs that are new fighters. Price 500, if compared to Pattaya, it is very cheap. The atmosphere of the boxing field can be enjoyed by drinking at a very affordable price and able to bet.
Worth going. 500bath. Never seen so close to the boxing competition before. Exciting night. Love that.

They have cars to pick up and send us to the accommodation. You can't find a stadium that can drink.
And can eat again. There are 6 pairs of fighters.
Spain punched the Thai people until he slept for a long time. And we are glad that he was okay after the doctor took care of.

I read a lot of negative reviews but our experience was excellent. Big crowd on a Saturday night and all fights we competitive and exciting. Obviously not top tier fighters yet but as an intro to the sport it was a terrific night out.

Good environment and all the seats are great, but the fights seem very staged. Of the 6 fights we watched three were round 1 knockouts, and the headliner lasted until the middle of the second. It did not feel very authentic and at best they were mismatches. The female fighters put in a great effort and gave great performance though!

reviews.author_name: พลพัตร ไฝเครือ
reviews.text: I am sorry for many people who went back first. The main pair will be in the back. Which is different from the first 2 to 3 pairs that are new fighters. Price 500, if compared to Pattaya, it is very cheap. The atmosphere of the boxing field can be enjoyed by drinking at a very affordable price and able to bet.
Worth going. 500bath. Never seen so close to the boxing competition before. Exciting night. Love that.

They have cars to pick up and send us to the accommodation. You can't find a stadium that can drink.
And can eat again. There are 6 pairs of fighters.
Spain punched the Thai people until he slept for a long time. And we are glad that he was okay after the doctor took care of.

I read a lot of negative reviews but our experience was excellent. Big crowd on a Saturday night and all fights we competitive and exciting. Obviously not top tier fighters yet but as an intro to the sport it was a terrific night out.

Pleasantly surprised! Spacious, well arranged, ventilated, well lit, great exhibits providing information in Thai and (decent) English regarding the history of the Northern (Lanna) Region, the arrival and spread of Buddhism into the different parts of Thailand, and more. 

Personally, as it was my first visit, I was very impressed by some of the displays, and the English translations - while containing some errors, was reasonably well done. 

Thoroughly enjoyed my time there, depending on how you enjoy your museum visits, this one could range any where between 1-3 or even 4 hours. 

As I was visiting with elders, I was also very impressed at the availability of an elevator (there are 2 levels), and I noticed ramps with handrails connecting some of the display areas that were set apart from the main areas.

Highly recommended for people who are interested on learning about the North. 😊👍

Good displays but not enough information about what the items mean or why all those items are there. No map either to understand where each item comes from. Tourists don't know Thai districts off by heart...

We were expecting more than what the museum presented. It was mostly Buddha statues in different sizes and materials, deity statues and other statues related to Buddhism without much background knowledge and limited interactive exhibits
Quite a nice small museum at the outskirts of Chiangmai. You can find there exhibitions mostly related to northern Thai culture. If there - I recommend visiting Wat Jed Yod.

This official museum provides visitors with a cultural understanding. Most of the pieces are about Lanna artifacts and northern Thai history. It is located outside the old town. For the tourist like me, it’s not very convenient to arrange the trip. But I enjoyed the sophisticated Buddhist statues, their faces and the shapes are perfect.  I think It is worthy to visit, although my daughter felt boring.
An awesome place ! You must go! You can learn a lot about mosquitos and malaria. A fantastic home full of science !

I'm so glad I came here! It's apparent somebody (two people) took a lot of time to decorate this place. The stories that accompany the exhibits are educational, inspiring, and even heartwarming at times. It's not entirely about insects - it's about the passions of two people (and that extends beyond insects).

Wonderful private collection of dead insects, fossils, & rocks/minerals. Very insightful corner about all things mosquito-related. One can see personal touch everywhere here.
Too bad there's no section for ants/termites.
nice quiet. low key. huge amount of insects and rocks and some small creatures. if you can't read Thai or English I wouldn't bother. The malaria section was most interesting to me.
Absolutely worth it. Cozy space with thousands of specimens and a great history.

Pleasantly surprised! Spacious, well arranged, ventilated, well lit, great exhibits providing information in Thai and (decent) English regarding the history of the Northern (Lanna) Region, the arrival and spread of Buddhism into the different parts of Thailand, and more. 

Personally, as it was my first visit, I was very impressed by some of the displays, and the English translations - while containing some errors, was reasonably well done. 

Thoroughly enjoyed my time there, depending on how you enjoy your museum visits, this one could range any where between 1-3 or even 4 hours. 

As I was visiting with elders, I was also very impressed at the availability of an elevator (there are 2 levels), and I noticed ramps with handrails connecting some of the display areas that were set apart from the main areas.

Highly recommended for people who are interested on learning about the North. 😊👍

Good displays but not enough information about what the items mean or why all those items are there. No map either to understand where each item comes from. Tourists don't know Thai districts off by heart...

We were expecting more than what the museum presented. It was mostly Buddha statues in different sizes and materials, deity statues and other statues related to Buddhism without much background knowledge and limited interactive exhibits
Quite a nice small museum at the outskirts of Chiangmai. You can find there exhibitions mostly related to northern Thai culture. If there - I recommend visiting Wat Jed Yod.

This official museum provides visitors with a cultural understanding. Most of the pieces are about Lanna artifacts and northern Thai history. It is located outside the old town. For the tourist like me, it’s not very convenient to arrange the trip. But I enjoyed the sophisticated Buddhist statues, their faces and the shapes are perfect.  I think It is worthy to visit, although my daughter felt boring.

This Buddhist temple compound is pretty large and very beautiful. The stupas are clad in gold and gardens were manicured. This is an active temple so you will see plenty of monks going about their daily lives. Try not to bother them! The eastern gate closes late afternoon so you need to enter and exit through the western gate after 5pm or 6pm. It’s nice to come at night to see the moons light reflecting off the gold. Admission is free. As always cover your knees and shoulders!

Beautiful picturesque spiritual place. There was a lot to see and a lot of space to explore and all for free! The elephant statues are cool and apparently there is a very ancient Buddha statue which is also free to see.

Stunning to look at, calm and tranquil. Early evening it’s quiet with hardly any tourists and if your lucky you can see the tiny bats flying from tree to tree. By far my favourite Wat in chaing Mai sit and take in the positive energy
A more peaceful temple compared to others in old town Chiangmai. Come at dusk to see the sun on the golden temple!
Very nice and quiet temple with a lot of benches to rest. I feel relaxed just sitting under the tree and looking at the Temples.

Came here during Night time. Only a few tourists were here during Night. You will have the place when you go here during Night. The views are absolutely stunning. Definitely worth the visit.

If you go here by scooter/motorbike/motorcycle, then no need to go to Parking Area, just park at the side of the road. FREE PARKING. 

It's about 40 mins to go here from Central Area of Chiang Mai. Worth the visit!

The place is really beautiful, and I came around at the very right time when Chiang Mai has its clear blue sky. So aside from enjoying the beautiful temple, I also able to enjoy the fascinating clear blue sky which is quite hard to find nowadays~

Absolutely beautiful temple! All the gold and statues are amazing! One of the nicest I’ve seen! 

They also have monk statues that look SO real! I was shocked 😂

Beautiful temple complex, definitely worth a visit. Charging foreigners an entrance fee is petty - it's only 20 baht but would have donated more if not compulsory. The smaller temple behind the main one is very nice and tranquil, if you want to pray or meditate it's a better choice.

Nice to walk through, be respectful and dress appropriately. There are Buddhist monks and worshipers here. If you want to enter temples there is a 20 baht entrance fee for foreigners only.
The area has quiet a few temples to look at and enter and they are beautifully decorated. Peaceful area, yet in the heart of the city. It's worth a visit if you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of Chiang Mai.

The temple is considered among Thai people as an important destination for pilgrimage. That does mean that it is equally important under a touristic point of view. It is 15 kilometers away from the City on a hill top. So special arrangements have to be made to get there. In the past one had a good view of the city from there. Nowadays the air in Chiang Mai is so polluted that one cannot see anything from there except a sea of fog.
The location is highly touristic. There are busloads of tourists from East Asia that visit the temple. Although there are signs that tell everybody to be quiet, most of these tourists are too excited to even see the sings, what to say about following this suggestion.
The construction of the temple started in 1368. According to a legend a white elephant determined where the temple was to be built. The golden Chedi is impressive and the surrounding buildings are also nice. But, as I said, the atmosphere is more that of a tourist attraction than that of a place of pilgrimage. In short: If you have little time in Chiang Mai, you can drop this temple from you list of destinations without missing a high-light.

A pretty temple with some good views over the city. Having said that, Chiang Mai isn't the most photogenic metropolis from above and there are nicer temples around the Old Town. For me, it wasn't worth the long, winding drive to get up here. I wouldn't describe it as 'must-see' like many guidebooks do.

Amazing experience. Get ready to walk a solid flight of stairs for the full experience. Go later in there evening for sunset. It's less crowded. Actually it's very serene, quiet and peaceful at that time . Dress modestly to enter temples. Great views.

Highly overrated. Very crowded and the place seems to be almost all tourist attraction. There are pretty things to see for sure but the many other temples in Chiang Mai are a much better experience. If you have an extra day you should go just for the ride up the mountain. If you have limited time then you are better off to wander old town and see the many beautiful and real temples there. They are far less crowded and more authentic.

The view is something for sure. When I was there the smog was really bad though so all I could see was haze covering the outline of the town. It was more sad than beautiful.

In particular stay away from the meditation center. From the moment you walk in there are many signs pointing you to the meditation center. Being a student off meditation I followed the many signs down many steps that led to a room clearly designed for meditation. I removed my shoes and walked in. I was there maybe a minute when a very gruff man came to me and told me I was not allowed there. I honestly thought he was ready to throw me physically out and was offended in a major way by my presence. He told me I had to go to the office. I went to the office and no one was there. They should make the signs more clear.

If you do go rent a scooter if you are comfortable with that. If not get an open vehicle so you can see the view. Stop at the two waterfalls on the way up. Both are worth the time.

Very cool but also very crowded. Everyone is taking bowing pics which I thought was a little macabre but whatever. If you want to do the hike its about 2 hours and pretty difficult and steep so prepare accordingly. Bring water and bug spray and proper shoes! I don't really recommend it it's kind of a boring hike without many if any view points. I would recommend taking a taxi or driver to the top doing a little shopping and taxing back. Try to smoothies they are amazing! I got a strawberry, banana, avocado - they will let you mix and match.

When you go into the Temple you need to wear clothes that cover your knees and shoulders. If you want to you can buy the cool elephant pants and shirts at one of the shops right outside. 

Enjoy!
Very nice setting. Good place to find a rest in the forest. March is a good time if you like autumn-feeling. Falling leaves and leaves on the ground, yet still very warm/hot.

This is my favourite temple in Chiang Mai. It's directly in the nature near a sea, a mysterious underground temple with old relics and a somber mood. It's a beautiful place to walk around and enjoy the quiet, with monks going about their daily life. There is also a meditation center.

My friend and I came in March, and the temple was gorgeous, unique wat set into the forest. The air was filled with the raucous songs of cicadas, along with white butterflies. Don't miss the lake nearby on the left, where you can feed the catfish and tortoises bits of bread for 10 baht. You might see some turtles sunning on some branches along with some frogs and roosters!
Tranquil and religious. Have never seen a Buddhist temple with a tunnel structure. Very unique. Foreigner has to pay a small fee to enter (20 Baht)

Probably the best temple complex in Chiang Mai because it is set in the forest than the city. The buildings are more like ruins which adds to the mystique of it. The underground is cool. There is a meditation centre near by which would be nice to check out, the next time I am through.

Many good food stalls around here, and at very reasonable prices. If you're into local food, here's the place to visit as you get a wide selection of various food items in this food mall. Go for the stalls with long queues, and you won't go too wrong.

Food outlets here are above average in quality and variety.
Very large under cover eating area with live (loud) music.
The corner shop makes rhe best pad thai 👍 very very reasonable price. So yammy. Been there few times already.

Love little Istanbul in the food court. Naina Indian food is good too. The lady that makes Thai food (stall with the disco light) makes good food too- she gives a good size serving too(Food for 2) 

This place is priced for tourists. Don't expect 35baht pad Thai.
Very good nice FOOD prices is good

Many good food stalls around here, and at very reasonable prices. If you're into local food, here's the place to visit as you get a wide selection of various food items in this food mall. Go for the stalls with long queues, and you won't go too wrong.

Food outlets here are above average in quality and variety.
Very large under cover eating area with live (loud) music.
The corner shop makes rhe best pad thai 👍 very very reasonable price. So yammy. Been there few times already.

Love little Istanbul in the food court. Naina Indian food is good too. The lady that makes Thai food (stall with the disco light) makes good food too- she gives a good size serving too(Food for 2) 

This place is priced for tourists. Don't expect 35baht pad Thai.
Very good nice FOOD prices is good

Lots of fun. Just on the other side of the moat makes Lucky a great place after midnight. Staff and owner very friendly. Drinks were great but on the pricier side. Music was wonderful live band and then DJ playing really good underground house music on the night we were there. The roller doors shut, we rearranged the the tables to make a dance floor and got down.

To put it simply, best traditional Issan food in CM..
Went with a big group unexpected, and every single dish that came out was phenomenal.
Expect great simple service, good prices and cold beer.
Always great. Feel like Home.

I visited this place a year ago for a drink or two. I am still angry they stole 500 baht from me. I paid with a 1000 bill and they said it was a 500 baht bill. I didnt have any 500 baht bills at the time! Please avoid this dump. It was clearly not an honest mistake because they had their whole routine of talking about but not retrieving CC tv.
You can see some football match from Liga or Serie A.....nice and clean, music very laugh and.....

I went for Thai curry and left a little disappointed. We got Red and Pumpkin. The Red came out Brown with a lot of beef and mushrooms, but not the egg plant or string beans advertised. The flavor was good, though. The pumpkin curry was bland and sweet. There are more affordable restaurants in the area with better curry.

Excellent food, beer, and management!  You will be pleased coming to this location for a meal or drink.  Great overall selection with very reasonable prices - the food is consistent and service is fantastic, be sure to share a beer with Elle
Scrambled eggs on toast was a delicious breakfast.  The cheap coffee was nice too.
The first place I ate in Chiang Mai. Khao soi was very tasty. Spring rolls were crispy and delicious.
Grilled pork with herbs and spices. Such an innocent name for such a devilishly delicious dish. Definitely coming back again!

Located just over Thapae gate in the inner city at convinience location.
The western food is slightly expensive, Thai food price is acceptable since shop located in expensive town center.
Food was excellent and affordable. Bathrooms were spotless. Would eat here again!
Good prices, nice food, well located at one of the msin streets

Happen to walk into this little hole in the wall gem of Thai food restaurant by accident. It was raining and to avoid getting soaked, my friend and I sat down. To our surprise the service, quality of food and the taste was wonderful! Highly recommend green curry fried rice with shrimp and stir fry noodles with chicken. Also they make really cute looking lattes! Oh, and their mango sticky rice was great too!
Stuffed omelette with rice was delicious! Good coffee lots of options. The mango sticky rice looked amazing but didn’t try yet. 120b for breakfast. Clean and good staff.

This is my second time here after two years ago. The ambient is still as rustic as the same two years ago. 

This time round I was bit more  adventurous ordered the Stir Fried Ant’s Egg omelette with Spicy Minced Fish Salad (ordered last trip here) still as good as before and do remember to garnish with the Thai herbs, mint to give a refreshing taste buds. 

The Spicy Chicken Soup with Banana Flower was a prefect combination with with the sticky rice. 

The last to end with the meal I ordered the Sticky Rice with Corn & coconut Milk (make sure you requested for some ice into the dessert with some coldness to it.

The food was great. We got there just before it got SUPER crowded. 
The waiters seem to not speak English very well but were pretty accommodating regardless. 
I enjoyed it and the food was great.

Long wait. Average food. Forgot my drink order. And the cheeky waiter at the end tried to take 30% of my bill as a tip!!!

You had a good reputation before, keep paying attention to details as people expect more!

Truly fantastic restaurant. Been here twice and both times it was really great, and worth waiting for.

Try to put down a common name on the waiting list (even if that’s not your name) because the waiters struggle otherwise.

But worth the initial awkwardness and the sometimes long wait. Waiters are really nice as well.

Waiter: "No, that meal is not spicy." Me after finishing my meal: "It's been 10 minutes and my lips are still burning." English printed in the menu (pictures too), but all signage is in Thai. Find the clipboard under the red sign with white lettering and a downward pointing arrow to add your name to the list to get a table. Beautiful place. Authentic food.

Nice enough but not sure I’d go back again. The venue is great, right in the middle of the market. They have a good selection of dishes available and most were nice. One of the broths didn’t really taste of much and the Tom Yum soup was excruciatingly spicy, but the rest were fine. 

As someone previously mentioned, the caipirinhas here are great - probably the highlight of the meal!
Traditional inexpensive Thai food in an outdoor setting.  Most of staff speaks english.
Amazing food, definitely go for the seafood options. It was really busy with locals when we went. Always a good sign! Would come back.

We wouldn't come back here! We ordered 2 dishes; belly pork and a red curry. The belly pork came and was eaten by me but 15 mins after I had finished, my partner's red curry still hadn't arrived. A waiter noticed and went running to the kitchen and another 5 mins later, just as we asked to cancel, the dish came out and was totally tasteless. Theres better, cheaper places around

The river restaurant has a fabulous ambience with each table hauled upon stilts, the flowing river sets the mood just right as one basks in the authenticity of the place, the food is great and one can enjoy the fantabulous scenic surroundings.

They get 1 star for pretty setting. I tried to eat there. I was a solo diner & mindful to arrive early before the dinner rush. I checked out the menu & ordered before even being seated. I patiently waited & waited & waited. I had walked there & it was going to be dark soon. So I asked for my food take away. Waiter repeats it & brings me water. “No water,  food take away” I ask. “Oh kitchen forgot” he says. Maybe so or maybe he forgot to put in the order. Either way nobody there cared one bit. Terrible customer service. Shame on you!

Great ambience amongst the beautiful winter garden flowers...relaxing music...food was weighted towards the sweet side to my taste but this could be down to a regional variation. Come with friends and family for a relaxing meal.
Do remember to stop by and smell the flowers...!

Fantastic ambience and setting beside the lake in the most green corner of Chiang Mai city. The tulips & abundance of flowers are quite breathtaking. Food wise - we had 4 helpings of softshell crabs!! 3 helpings of pork ribs, 3 types of fish dishes... guaranteed to be great!

Must try Galae chicken.
Tasty and tender. You will feel the meat melt in you mouth together with beautiful aroma. One of the best roast chicken.
Slow service and food is nothing special. But nice surroundings and flowers. Seems to be popular with older people and families who have time to just sit there for a few hours.

Quite fun there. Food was okay, performance was interesting. Even though its a bit pricey, but it's good that it's in the town. Less efforts needed to travel far. My parents went to the other one and they said cultural center has more varieties of performances.

I would rate 10 start is I could. 
Dinner stars at 7 pm and you pay around 520 b per person for a buffet type dinning which includes vegetables, northern style dishes with meat, rice, fruits, water and tea, all of it refillable. 
Around 8 pm starts a performance, they have around 15 small dance shows from all around region accomplished with real life music. All of them enjoyable and in the end dancers encourage visitors to join them and learn some Thai dance moves. How nice it is! 
They would also take a picture of you and your mates, print it in a nice frame of Chiang Mai Cultural Centre and suggest to buy it for 100 b, picture is nice tho. 
I really love that place, here is some tips for your visit:
1. You should book your table earlier, to get best place on the floor by the stage.
2. Come earlier so stuff would take picture of you with no people on background. 
Recommend that place to everyone who would be interested in local culture and spend their time at its best.

Not the most professional show I've ever seen. But the food was amazing. And I really enjoyed the live music. The museum they promote was not open when we went and the "market" was about four stalls with items you'll see in all the markets.

We were there for the kantoke dinner / show. We had a very pleasant evening, good food (all you can eat), very attentive staff. The show was nice as well. We paid around 500 bahts, as we bought the ticket online through an agency.
Interesting concept. Like the idea of eating and enjoying a cultural thing. Didn't understand most of it, but still an interesting tourist trap.

My husband and I both had a bacon/cheese burger and fries and they were delicious. My husband ordered a Greek salad to start and it was huge. It was plenty for both of us to share and cost only around $3.00(US) The beer selection is good and reasonably priced. They also had a craft beer called Punk Pink IPA (I think) and it was a nice change and tasted great.

Excellent Sunday Lunch. All 3 meats excellent- Beef from Australia, Lamb from NZ, Pork probably local. Pub atmosphere is nice, little garden at front and rear. Husband (UK) and wife (Thai) owners who are very attentive.
Highly recommended.

Great bar!  I'm a home sick Sunday Roast addict and believe me Archers are right up there in the Roast and hospitality Hall of fame.   I'd also like to visit for the quiz and weekly food nights when I return to CM.  Mant thanks to the owners and staff and keep up the good work.
Did the quiz night on a Tuesday. They have a good set daily meal option. Good range of beers and the baguette I had was filling and tasty.

There is a  range of vegetarian (and some vegan) dishes that are fresh on the menu, as well as the great veggie Sunday roast - which can be made vegan on request.  The fun Tuesday quiz night is in English.  I'm also a fan of the finger food including the fries and the hummoes with pitta - no cutlery required! :D
Staff were fantastic... the food was decent and an appropriate price. The place was clean with good music and great atmosphere :)

Interesting American Saloon Concept

Nearby night life and other restaurants, the Chiang Mai Saloon was a fun spot to grab a beer and play bar games like pool or darts. They offer a variety of Thai and Western food, and it was fun to grab some appetizers and watch people walk by the front of the open bar too. Worth a stop for some finger food or a drink!
Great place.  Reasonable prices.

Most terrible place I ever have visit in Chiang Mai. Terrible food and not even taste like food. After complain they do nothing and let me pay for all also what I not have eat at all. Please avoid this place and like to give 0 stars instead of 1
A Texan-owned restaurant with a good selection of burgers and Tex-Mex food in a saloon-type setting.

Our family had dinner at the Texas roadhouse Durham location - food was delicious and hot! Our server Lydia never let us run out of drinks, rolls or napkins - she filled our every need and was so sweet and friendly! She was the best waitress and made our first trip to a Texas Roadhouse a great experience! We definitely will be returning when we are back in the Durham area!

This was my first time here. I ordered the 5 oz salmon with a baked sweet potato and broccoli. The salmon seemed like it had a good amount of salt on it and it was cooked very well done. I wasn’t a fan of that. The broccoli and sweet potato were fine. 
When you sit the server brings out hot rolls with a whipped butter l maybe it was cinnamon one? It was really good though. 
I don’t remember the servers name but she wasn’t very present and did not come to check on our table often enough. We had to ask other servers for things. 
Overall it was an ok experience. I would like to come back for dinner and order a steak since I think this is what the restaurant is known for. I came for lunch and did not want to eat anything to heavy since I had to go back to work.

We ordered from there last night & our supposedly "well done" steaks were very pink (ordered online & even called to verify WELL, WELL DONE). Next day, they corrected them BUT it's like the sides were made by a total different restaurant, even down to the bread was different... No consistency at all!! Very disappointed, to say the least. For my husband & I to spend $60+ or more each order, I'm done FOR A WHILE, at this point. What kind of cook sends out a mid-well done steak out, as a well done steak?
Meal & service was awesome even though they were very busy  Steaks were cooked perfect! Waitress was great! No complaints at all. Had a great time & meal!

My family loves Texas Roadhouse. We eat here almost every week. It is a wonderful experience, but sometimes we'll have issues with the time it takes to get our food after we've ordered. It can often be busy during prime hours and that is to be expected. The atmosphere is nice, if you don't mind a loud place that's filled with country music, which I don't. I'd recommend the steaks, as they are punching way above their weight class when it comes to flavor at the price.

Very good quality food served with lots of respect in terms of communication and services. I requested her to make Pure Vegetarian food with my choice of ingredients in burger, and she did it very well & I really like that taste.

I recommend all pure vegetarian should visit this once.
Price is also reasonable. One average person can eat within 150 Baht.
Excellent food! Iced coffee was amazing and vegetables were very fresh. Will for sure be back!
The food is actually good! We enjoyed the food here. Lady boss speaks English and very friendly.  If you are driving here, do find parking elsewhere as within 100 metes area is quite hard to find.

Excellent! Fantastic, really good! Comida fabulosa, se agradece después de tantos días viajando! 

The place looks closed when we walked by, but it just lacks outside light! 

Super nice food, highly recommended!
Good food options. Loved the Thai iced tea. They even made vegetarian options for my friend.
Amazing khao soi and unique pad Thai ! Also lunch deals for 99 baht. The apple iced tea was super refreshing and not packed with sugar
Staff was welcoming. Food was good and delicious.
Pad Thai is amazing! We came back twice and order the same thing 😋
Great food in a beautiful place. A nice experience :)
Had Tom Yum and Khao Soi and enjoyed every bite.

I had read about this place online and decided to try there once. Me and my husband are absolute foodies and we reached there. We asked for a corner table to sit and relax so that we could eat more and for long. We ordered salads , berries and fruit juices, hot dog and burger. Everything whatever we ordered was so tasty and so presentable. They serve you in the most stylish way. Food was yummy and tempting. I recommend this place as a must go.

Fun to come back after many years and see this place explode in popularity. I used to go when it first opened and liked the build a salad concept. Now they have an expansive menu with full juice bar. Now I have a place to score cold pressed juice. Excellent spot to take kids as well.

I really enjoyed this place. I got a huge salad. It comes with a lettuce and various leaf base and then you can add up to 5 Ingredients for free. 6 bhat for additional veggie, and up charges for things like tofu and meat. You also get one free dressing. I was totally full, and felt super healthy after eating this lovely salad.

A great option for vegans or Westerners hankering for non-Thai options. The way to go is the customization option. The waitstaff does not have great English speaking skills so this is something you need to sort out—at your table you will find sheets where you can customize salads, wraps and drinks. But, as the name suggests, this place is focused on anything salad focused. I would stray away from anything else here.

A great first visit! Was personally very impressed by the variety and extensive menu available, ranging from soups, salads, wraps, pastas, and so many other options. Seems very health-oriented with vegan options and many fresh juices to choose from.

We have always been hesitant to visit due to its location on bustling Nimman road, but there is a 2hour free parking lot available down the Soi, which is such a relief. Service was pretty good and quite fast, considering our arrival during the peak noon hours, when the place was over half occupied. 

Clean, spacious, good food, good service - overall, a great experience!

Delicious food and good service.  Large variety of Italian dishes served in an unhurried atmosphere.

The artichoke appetizer was delicious.  Ceaser salad dressing good.  Well cooked pastas.   For family groups you may want to make a reservation.   This place seems to fill up.

The food are amazing!!!! I’ve been literally taken to heaven. We had salad, cold cuts, ravioli and risotto. All tastes divine. The portion is generous and not expensive. The place is simple yet comfortable and relax. Somehow their house wine is not a thrill for me. If I go next time I might carry my own bottle. I strongly recommend to dine at the place!

Always great food, and great service.

My wife and I have been coming here for years and the food has been consistently good.

The pricing is fair, and on some items I think is remarkably cheap. Comfortable surroundings and never too busy, so you generally get served promptly.

The staff are lovely, and they genuinely seem to care that you are enjoying your meal or not. If you leave anything as you are full up, they will ensure that everything was to your liking.

Highly recommended.
Thw Best Homemade Italian Food in this city
Great food and friendly staff!  One of our favorite spots for sure!

Stopped here for a quick coffee and was impressed by the service, cleanliness and quality. Ordered a Piccolo latte using local beans from Chiang Rai and it was perfect. We could pay with card which was a bonus and the restaurant was nice and air conditioned. Best coffee experience in the city.

Price : relatively high in CM but reasonable.
Location : Near the eastern gate of the city. Easy to reach.
Food : Nice both of the taste and the outlook
Environment :nice I think it should be a nice place for dating.

OMG!  I'm totally in love with this place, not only the decoration, staff are nice with friendly smile always,  delicious food, reasonable price.  They have a nice shop here too.
You MUST come when you at Chiang Mai, highly recommend! 😍😍😍😍😍
Very nice dishes and service. The atmosphere was very nice as well.

Not as good as I had hoped, the staff and service was fantastic. But for what was my most expensive meal our so far in Thailand I was left quite underwhelmed, Tom Yum soup had no spice or body to it, the only good point where the three large prawns in there.

I absolutely adore this restaurant. The food is authentic Italian cuisine, using only the freshest, local and imported organic ingredients . Quality wine available to always compliment the meal. Portions are typically Italian, you won't leave hungry. Service is first class as you would expect from a Michelin chef owner. Prices are in line with what you would expect to pay at a first class establishment. If you want a truly unique and fine dining experience,  Piccola Roma will not disappoint.

Have been here a number of times during our trips to Chiang Mai and always loved it!! 

However, a few nights ago my boyfriend and another one of our friends got food poisoning after both eating the lasagne, and now days have been taken off our holiday due to sickness. Please keep your food standards in check, to save this from happening again 🙂 Took a few stars off for this reason.

Decent Italian food. Very personal touch with owner / chef taking order. Penne carbonara was clumpy. I've had good ravioli here. Clearly had it's day, but if you're seeking Italian food in Chiang mai your options are limited.

Great for celebrations and a special treat. Authentic Italian dishes. I had the penne puttanesca that had a bit of a twist in that chilli was added and savoured every bit of it along with a glass of chardonnay. The staff are friendly and helpful and the Italian chef (I'm guessing he was also the owner) was even  the one who served me my order. I would definitely come back and bring friends with me to enjoy

This is our favorite Italian restaurant in Chiang Mai. We live here and come often. The owner is lovely and always helpful. We are vegetarian and there are lots of good veg options here. I find the quality of the food matches the price - very consistent and always so good! !

Famous for it's breakfast style restaurant. Had the set E which is 2 breads, one juice and one plate of eggs (2 eggs on it)

Best way to start your morning when you go here and eat in this restaurant!

They also have Rice, Green Tea, and Noodle. If you want to try their best seller, the try their Set E (or F if you want tea), you won't regret going here because it's very delicious! 

Recommended to all!
So simple.. but AMAZING! I had a to die for creation of eggs and sausage for 40 baht. Good service too.

Opens as early as 06.30am, near the morning market and serves local breakfast. Breads, eggs, porridge...etc. We had the bread with tofu and mushrooms, delicious. Porridge was tasty and satisfying. Thai coffee is usually a little weak, so the Vietnamese coffee on the menu was a great way to kick start the day (it comes with sweetened condensed milk). No regrets eating here. Once done, go for a walk at the market and enjoy the sights.

As other reviewers state - a convivial place, pleasant, clean and prices that are unrivalled where I come from. 40bht-60bht pan eggs rolls inclusive of coffee or juice. Wow. Authentic delicious vietnamese noodle soup and rice porridge. Whilst I only stopped for a snack - I've lived here long enough to know it lives up to its reputation as a breakfast institution on thus side of town. Small and cozy - you may not speak thai but breakfast is a universal language and you will make yourself understood easily.
Nice breakfasts and not too expensive. We like it.

One of thr best Japanese restaurants in Chiang mai.
However their quality is inconsistent and it makes me unwilling to come back to this place.
Sometimes it is a very real taste of Japan, and sometimes it is a typical Thai Japanese - poor choice of ingredients and everything is too sweet.

I have dined at this small, tastefully decorated restaurant twice and have added it to my “frequent flyer” dining list. Both visits have been delightful in every way: the food, the service, the ambiance. It is located on an easy access soi but may be missed because it is located at the very end of a driveway off the soi. Look for the small sign with a departing elephant outline saying “Japanese Restaurant” and ๑๑ on it.
excellent food for a fair price. amazing service. very cozy. we liked it and will be back for more :)
Very helpful staff. The janpaese garden is very serene and food is yummy. Highly recommended
Home cooking style Japanese food. We ordered so many dishes. They’re all good.

Excellent all you can eat for 369 (june/16)
Open from 3 to 10pm
Nice Music, nice location. Good prices
Great
Nice
Espectacular... El mejor q he probado nunca

This is my favourite restaurant in Chiang Mai! And I have been to A LOT living here now for 4 months! As a strict vegetarian I feel so comfortable eating here and knowing everything is cooked fresh and made with love. The owner is an amazing man and chef! And his staff are all very hard working lovely people. My boyfriend is a meat eater and he still wants to eat here 3-4 times a week because it's that good! When we go back to Ireland we will think about your wonderful food. Thank you 😊🙏❤️

Had a lovely meal here. The restaurant is down a quiet alley and had a few seats available when we arrived, around 715 pm. 

After being seated we were given the menu and a pen. It's a paper menu where those seated at the table select their dish and number of dishes. 

Menu selection is huge with curries, soups, stir fry, fried rices, fried treats, and drinks. All sounded so good, all are vegetarian with some dishes being vegan. Almost all the dishes are vegetarian versions of popular Thai dishes.

After ordering we got our drinks and food came out after about 20 or so minutes. The kitchen is open to the restaurant with 3-4 people cooking. As it's not a huge kitchen be prepared to wait a bit for your food if it's busy. 

The dishes themselves we're excellent. Tons of super fresh veggies and seasoned well. If you're a meat eater, you really won't miss it. Portions are also large, we could have easily split a curry. They also serve local brown and mixed rice, not the usual white rice found throughout Asia.

Prices were fair for the area with mains being around 120 to 180 baht. For the quality of food and portion size the prices are fantastic. 

Staff were friendly and prompt, and the general atmosphere of the place can be described as welcoming and healthy! 

All in all, a great meal.
Pleasant restaurant with a nice atmosphere. Food was pretty good, some interrsting flavours and very fresh. It is on the pricier side though, coming in at 400 baht for three dishes and water.

Great Vegetarian restaurant. I'm an omnivore, but the vegetarian dish that I had at Anchan was really, really good and packed with vegetables. It was the tofu fried rice with mixed vegetables, highly recommended. My wife had the veggie Thai omelet, extra tasty. Our whole bill came out to 310 BHT.

Super cute little hole in the wall restaurant! Neither my boyfriend or I are vegetarian but we heard good things about this place and had to check it out. Cozy atmosphere, it was quite busy when we showed up but the service was still great. Had the curry, corn fritters and sweet and sour tofu stir fry and it was all absolutely delicious!
Absolutely amazing!  Very kid friendly!  My six year son won’t eat meat but he did enjoy the bread and the rice!  We definitely will be back!  If you get a chance this place is a must!!!

The falafel wrap is to die for! The hummus is also amazing. Been here a for times since being in Chiang Mai and I've never had a bad meal. Do yourself a favor and have some authentic food that isn't just Pad Thai!
Highly recommend this restaurant. Amazing middle eastern food, some of the best I’ve ever had. The falafel was amazing.
One of the greenest falafels I’ve ever seen! Great hummus and tabouleh too.
Get set 1 (veg) or set 2(meat). Great food, great owners. It might be my favorite food in Chiang Mai, even though I love Thailand. If not, it's definitely top three.

As a comparison to what vegetarian food is available elsewhere and taste wise this place wins for me. Very reasonably priced too. I ate a self chose large buffet plate and two spring rolls and it was a mega meal. Love the variety of vegey mock meats, so many varieties and textures... Going back later!
Great vegan buffet. It is open later than many of the other vegetarian buffet places and one can get an inexpensive massage on the temple grounds across the street. Delicious khao soi.
Best vegetarian Khao Soi in all Chiang Mai! Very reasonable prices. All the items on the menu are vegetarian too! Fast service and very friendly. Please do yourself a favor and go here

Hands down the best food I’ve had in SE Asia (also the cheapest)! We ate here several times and it has been amazing every time. 
You should absolutely try their Khao Soi!

Love coming here in the afternoons for lunch. The mushrooms are fantastic and the veg stir fry is great. The prices are also very affordable, especially being in the center of the city. If you go in the evening, the food is often cold and there isn't much selection.
This place is a gem. The food is absolutely delicious, and it has a nice chill vibe. I'm going to come every day for lunch for the rest of my trip. I highly recommend the banana flower salad.

This was the first restaurant that I ate in when I came to Thailand. The staff is friendly, the ingredients are fresh, the atmosphere is calm and meditative. During my five weeks in Thailand I visited this restaurant many times. It is very close to Wat Suan Dok. There is at least another location located in Chiang Mai as well. The prices are very reasonable and the food is incredible. If you come for lunch, you should either come early or late, otherwise you will wait a long time. It is worth the wait I assure you.

A little hard to find, but really worth it. Food was brilliant and there’s quite a few dishes to choose from. Their iced teas are also excellent. Loved everything about the place and nicely priced as well.

Amazing vegetarian and vegan food at this lovely cafe at the temple. They also have a variety of smoothies and fruit juices if you are just looking for a snack. The prices are very reasonable, too. I recommend the pineapple fried rice! It was served with an egg, small soup, and a few veg on the side. This is also a great place to try Thai Milk Tea.

Hidden place in the Suandok temple that is why you meet locals and tourists likewise.
Quite a big menu, all vegetarian, great variety of teas and juices. Service was really friendly....simple and fast cheap eat if you are in the area.

Excellent food and service. Will definitely go back. 

Update: We went back again after a year and still delicious food, great service and reasonable prices. Everything we tried off the menu was delicious. They have a big parking lot next door. Nice but limited outdoor seating is available.
This place never disappointed me. Delicious food.

Consistently clean good food. I am unable to reference actual Vietnamese food, having not travelled there yet, however Namnueng offers what seems authentic and affordable dishes in a open air or upstairs conditioned environment.
Good qualities. Cheap price. Recommended
Amazing Vietnamese food two of us ate till our bellys hurt for 550baht(about £12/14)

Love walking into a Starbucks and smelling the fresh coffee. This location was clean and the staff friendly. Coffee was made to order and correctly made for this picky coffee drinker lol. This spot has an area for when you are wanting to socialize or break out the computer/books and do some studying while sipping on a latte. Only problem I seen was the drive through and parking area are very tight but couldn't take a star away just for that. Keep it up at this location cause my little girl and I will definitely be back for our coffee.
Always fast, friendly, and informative! Their coffee is great and their snacks are always yummy! Mobile pickup through their app is always very convenient as well!

Yummy but prices need to stop going up, they  are beyond being a very successful business that has millions of people addicted and stopping for ine of their many yummy beverages and foods almost every day like its crack, stop being greedy with the cost increase of everything, PLEASE. I want to be able to afford my coffee "crack" lol just playing, kinda. Attention there's no illegal drugs served at any Starbucks facility
... that I'm aware of!
Very friendly service. Got the order correct. Fast.
Rude, impersonal staff, slow service, dirty restrooms. The food is blah, you get better quality food at much lower prices at McDonalds or any of the other fast food chains in the area.

Minus one star for being open-air (self opinion). Myself just prefers air-conditioned. Except that, this is the best food mall I ever know. It is ranged from fair class food to medium-high. So that is suit for every age range.

Dude I love this Shopping Mall this is really great and has a lot of things to see. At the source surrounded by several other Shopping Malls where you can find everything. It is definitely worth it if you spent time in bkk

Locating next to Siam BTS. The place is full of eateries. They have Chinese, Korean, Japanese, Thai etc kind of food serving restaurants. If you want to eat something it is the correct place for you. Besides the mall also has section for fashion on the lower level. Behind the mall is another walking area where you might find an interesting place to eat and stores you might want to take a look into. It's a good place to explore at night.

Good enough place, i would however recommend that a center with such a huge turn over could afford more bins, and possibly a more interesting variety than the same old stuff found at every other shopping center. Other than that, it looks good, has some interesting things for sale.

On the other side of Siam Paragon in Bangkok, Siam Square One is another shopping mall. It serves many local restaurants as well as international cuisine. The Line Village shop is also located in this mall.

Friendly staff, clean pleasant decor and nice atmosphere and views..... let me correct that very very good pub inn. Exceptional friendly staff and good management  who are always mire than happy to accommodate your needs. Lovely to be there.
Truly delighted local pub. Great food, great beer, lovely ambiance and atmosphere.
Excellent. Great food, good service, kids happy and a nice and friendly atmosphere.

Good menu selections for New Year's Day, and relatively quiet at lunchtime.
Thanks for opening.
Very pleasant pub - good beers and and really excellent food. Parking could be tricky although we were lucky and found a space in the small parking area at the front.  Dog-friendly.
